title: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor
description: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor
OB: When the user chooses to close and reopen a file in the Java editor without saving changes, it takes about 8 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original. However, if the user selects 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor after performing the same steps, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1) Open an editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository.
2) Select the end of the first line and add a space character to mark the file as dirty.
3) Click on the close box in the editor tab and choose 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog.
4) Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
5) Repeat steps 1) and 2).
6) Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
7) Observe that it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
